result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Allan Sorenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) These financial obligations may be collected from prison wages.
2) Upon release from custody, defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $50 per month.  
3) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant shall maintain gainful employment following his release from custody.
Defendant shall not use or possess any firearms for life.
Defendant shall not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

1) Defendant shall undergo a sexual risk assessment and follow all recommendations.
AMENDED 11-04-2019:  2) Defendant must comply with Wisconsin Statute 301.45 regarding sex offender registration. Defendant may be released from registration requirements 15 years after discharge from Probation.  
3) Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
4) Defendant shall submit to regular drug testing.

from DOC
Victim impact statement on an uncharged, read in charge. (Original copy no easier to read).

03:07 PM Defendant, Mark Allan Sorenson, appeared with Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State.  Case is on for plea/sentencing hearing.    Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Bonneson- def will plead G to 1 count of exposing genitals, State will not request prison, will request PSI, will dismiss other counts, will not charge def with sexual assault charge (uncharged read-in).  DA states that he defers to the court in terms of ordering a PSI.  DA states that State will be free to argue up to 1 year of jail time and will recommend an imposed/stayed prison sentence.  State is free to argue whether or not court orders def to be on the sex offender registry.    
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands what def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds defendant guilty to said Count 1 and orders a JOC; other counts are DRI.  
DA argues for: Def to register on sex offender registry for 15 years; after 15 years, may be released off of that registry.  3 years probation, imposed/stayed 18 months IC and 2 yrs ES.  Provides victim impact statement to def and court.  Case is in victim's rights compliance.
Atty Bonneson argues that State's recommendation regarding probation, IC, and ES is appropriate; argues against registration on the sex offender registry.  Defendant makes statement.  
Court orders: 3 years of probation, consecutive to current sentence, with 1.5 years IC and 2 yrs ES im/stayed.  Probation conditions: undergo a sexual risk assessment and follow recommendations; absolute sobriety; regular drug testing; gainful employment.  Must register and be on sex offender registry for the length of time defendant is on probation- successfully discharge, does not need to register anymore.  No use/possession of firearm for life.  No voting in any election until civil rights are restored.  Assesses $518 in costs and fees- prison collects.  Following release from custody, payments of $50/mo.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  3 days jail credit.  Def must contact probation.  Appeal rights provided.  
DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
(Writ)
